attributes.action: Make the sale age of Tobacco 21
attributes.background:
Increasing the sale age to 21 would decrease the use of tobacco nationwide. 

But ultimately the main goal is to be the first country to ban the sale altogether.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside increasing the sale age to 21 this would decrease the use of tobacco use,  making steps towards the ultimate goal of banning the sale of tobacco altogether, the UK would make the first country to band the sale of a Dangerous cancer killing drug 

The idea that everyone knows how much it kills is the strangest part about it and as a country we need to me the first move.

attributes.action: Update food allergies laws to list allergens on menus in food establishments
attributes.background: In 2014, food allergies laws were passed for food establishments to tell customers if their food contains ingredients known to trigger allergies. It has recently become apparent staff don't always provide the correct information. An update is needed to make it compulsory for the info to be on menus

attributes.action: Nationalise UK mobile telephone masts.
attributes.background: 6 December 2018, O2 experienced a widespread failure affecting 20m+ UK customers. However other network providers continued to enjoy access. This petition would bring into public hands the network of phone masts, thus guaranteeing equality of access for customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Mobile data access is a key part of working and personal life for almost all people in the UK today. 

To have access for some and not for others when a network goes down is depriving large segments of the population with the ability to be productive, happy, and even safe.

It does not need to be this way, if the hardware of UK mobile data coverage was recognised as a natural monopoly and brought into public hands so it could also be managed in the public interest, all would be better off.

attributes.action: Change student loan arrangements to reflect career success
attributes.background:
The current arrangements reduce the incentive for students to achieve high-earning roles. Successful students see their debt increase every year until they are earning 4 x the average salary. 
Lower earners may never repay anything. This situation cannot be justified.
attributes.additional_details: The interest on the debt should be fixed at the no more than half a percent above the Bank of England rate when the loan is issued. Repayment should then be taken from all earnings/income (with no lower limit) at a rate that would pay the interest charges and reduce the outstanding balance. If students never work then the loan should be collected by a small reduction in any benefits.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of possible depo provera injection side effects
attributes.background: Depo provera injection for birth control and to stop periods I chose this was right treatment for myself only to of met my partner and us decide we want to try for a baby well as we looked deeply on the internet to see what side effects I would well what we found out was really bad and shocking.
attributes.additional_details: The mood swings, irregular periods, and potentially getting bone loss density which some women have through this the reading just shocked me if I had done more research 4+ years ago I would of never of had it. I think this injection should come with a warning label or taken off the market our nurses and doctors just don't know enough and should be well trained in this.

attributes.action: Force rail companies to freeze rail fares for at least 5 years.
attributes.background: The new rise in rail fares is criminal and only lining the pockets of the wealthy running the trains in Britain. We demand that the rail fares be frozen so that people are not being stripped of their cash and being made poorer just to get to work.

attributes.action: Call to ban ‘cruel’ pupil restraint in special schools
attributes.background: Hundreds of children have suffered injuries while being physically restrained in special schools. Teachers throw children to the ground, hold them so tightly it still hurts the next day and don’t talk to them when they are in distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Something has to be done. 
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39530915

attributes.action: Require unused hospital and pharmacy prescriptions to be reused, not thrown out
attributes.background: My client was a pharmacist in a UK hospital. All prescriptions that were not collected from patients are put in the bin if not collected and not reused. this is a complete waste of money. They are not opened and not used we need to stop this.

attributes.action: Allow 3 wheeled vehicles to be driven on a car licence at 17
attributes.background: In 2013 the law was changed so that 3 wheeled vehicles could not be driven on any licence until the person is 21 i can sort off understand this for motorcycle licences but not car licences

attributes.action: Make it law for all road users who do not indicate when turning, to pay a fine.
attributes.background:
I'm getting sick & tired of inconsiderate road users, whether they are operating a car, van, truck, motorcycle or bicycle. 
How many times have you sat at a busy junction & thought "if only this car wasn't coming across my path, I'd be able to get across". Only for them to turn without indicating!

attributes.action: Make payment from net income for residential care tax deductible for over 70's
attributes.background: The cost of residential and social care is extremely high. My Mother is 90 years old and has been in a residential home for three years. Her total income does not fully meet her monthly care charges. To alleviate the problem introduce a tax concession on bona fide care costs for those who pay.
attributes.additional_details: It would be a positive gesture from Government to recognise those who have made honest declarations and are subsequently burdened further by the tax system. The Government should also recognise that payments on account for current tax years are also onerous on meeting care costs and should be addressed. The Government should recognise that most people over the age of 70 are not on PAYE and the tax coding system is unreasonable for that population when in care.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for those working between 9pm and 7am to £14 p/h
attributes.background: Workers of late shifts—which have been proven to have detrimental effects on health—are increasingly common, and these workers are being exploited.
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco—who made a £1·6bl profit last quarter—pay staff near minimum wage to work until midnight. Clubs hire 18–21-year-olds at £5.60/h till 5.The real living wage in the U.K. is nearly £10/h: https://bbc.in/2JGrY0b This work is unhealthy and those employed deserve compensation.

Study noting an increase in the risk of an early death amongst night-shift workers: https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/oct/28/night-shift-three-million-workers-health-risks-obesity-cancer-diabetes

Radio 4 on damage to organs and the brain caused by nightwork: https://www.ajpmonline.org/article/S0749-3797(14)00623-0/fulltext

https://www.psych.ox.ac.uk/news/how-can-working-night-shifts-affect-mental-and-physical-health

attributes.action: Public investigation into treatment of people with autism/learning difficulties
attributes.background: Call on the government to investigate and reform the law so that the rights of parents, guardians or next of kin of people with autism/learning difficulties cannot be removed. Re: https://news.sky.com/story/40-people-died-in-barbaric-secure-hospitals-the-government-pledged-would-close-11540038
attributes.additional_details: It is in the general public’s best interest an investigation is carried out into the circumstances of the loss of life of people with a profound learning disability or autism who have died while admitted to secure hospitals or care homes over the last 40 yrs. Currently more than 2000 people are in assessment and treatment units with an average stay of more than 5 ½ years when they are supposed to be discharged within 18 months and their families do not have any right in deciding their treatment

attributes.action: Make it illegal for under 16's to have internet access on their mobile phones!
attributes.background: Children exposed to pornography at 9, cyber bullying see evidence link. Teenagers committing suicide because of cyber bullying, outrageous! They need constant supervision with the internet! It is far too dangerous and the safety of our children is the most important. It goes beyond parents control.
attributes.additional_details:
https://foreverymom.com/mom-gold/horror-stories-real-dont-give-children-smartphone-jonathon-van-maren/

I will give my daughter a cell phone when she is in year 6 and practising getting to school on her own ready for high school, but it will not have access to the internet, thats not going to stop other children who do have internet access from showing her inappropriate pictures or posting things about her though is it! For this to stop it needs to be illegal. They do not need internet access!

attributes.action: Make cat calling an illegal act in the UK
attributes.background:
Cat calling refers to the act of shouting harassing and often sexually suggestive, threatening, or derisive comments at someone publicly. 

Surveys have found that 85% of people under 40 years old have taken a different route home to avoid harassment. Cat Calling should not have this power.
attributes.additional_details:
End Violence Against Women Coalition commissioned YouGov to conduct the first national poll on street harassment in 2016. The poll found that 64% of women of all ages have experienced unwanted sexual harassment in public places.

There are laws in the UK which focus on sexual misconduct but none specifically related to catcalling. This is not an impossible task with countries like Portugal, Belgium and France having already implemented such laws.

attributes.action: Fund non-vocational degrees for people over 60
attributes.background: The Government should fund unallocated university places for non-vocational degrees for free, or for substantially reduced fees, to citizens over 60 who can demonstrate that they would be capable of completing their courses at a satisfactory level of attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
To expand on the idea of the U3A approach and to formalise it into a higher level of attainment for those wishing to pursue academic recognition.

To explore the Chinese model of learning available to older citizens in China: 
http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/23/WS5b2d4787a3103349141de584.html

attributes.action: Ban body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers
attributes.background: I have seen so many celebrity body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers. Teenagers are reading it. It can affect their state of mental health especially, including using 'photoshop' photos, 'perfect' bodies. This is the only way it'll stop.
attributes.additional_details: Most recent is Stacey Solomon was on front of Now Magazine with headline 'boring' 'desperate' 'cheap' and why fans are sick of her because they saw a couple comments about her continuous positivity on body confidence, and next there was another story about revenge bodies, and it's wrong to do this, and there should be a ban on body-shaming, bullying in magazines, and should focusing on celebrating your body, and be confident in your skin, and what you look like.

attributes.action: Bring in minimum standards for certain camping equipment sold in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a huge amount of camping equipment abandoned at festivals every year which is bad for the environment. Much of the equipment is of a poor standard and inadequate for the British summer leading to many people getting cold and wet to the extent that they need medical help.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum standards should be -
Tents must have an inner and outer skin and a minimum Hydrostatic Head rating of 3000. (Small play tents can be exempt.)
Any sleeping bag rated as suitable only for temperatures over 5 degrees centigrade should be clearly labelled "UK Indoors Only".
Roll mats must have a minimum thickness when compressed. 
All folding chairs and stools must have their maximum weight clearly displayed in kilogrammes and stones and pounds, in large letters on the sales label.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: Make good facial growth a strategic health priority.
attributes.background: We ask parliament to make good facial growth a strategic health priority, through an early years education programme and through supporting Public Health England to make research, analysis and treatment policy in this area part of their next strategic plan.
attributes.additional_details: More information can be found on www.preventcrookedteeth.com.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid a compulsory element of teacher training.
attributes.background: I'm Ben, I've set up this petition as part of a teenage mental health awareness campaign started after my brother, Sam West, tragically committed suicide aged 15 in January 2018. Your signature won't bring my brother back, but it could save someone else's life and that's all I want.
attributes.additional_details: Some teachers, who will remain anonymous, have reacted positively to the idea when it was put past them stating that teachers often won't act at all as they don't have the knowledge or confidence to deal with the situation. A compulsory course will provide the confidence to at least approach a student about their mental wellbeing and start working on a solution. This vital next move, which is cheaper than alternatives, can combat the ever-escalating problem which is teenage mental health.

attributes.action: UK to cut ties and impose sanctions on Pakistan until they rerun elections
attributes.background: It has been reported that the recent Pakistani elections were one of the dirtiest and most rigged elections in many years. The media reports that Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz was the main target of election irregularities and rigging across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to the media, Pakistan Army soldiers were present inside every polling station at the end of the polling before the polling count started they intervened and forced every polling agent to leave the polling premises. Political parties in Pakistan have rejected these rigged polls. Pakistan's Election Commission should conduct free and fair elections.

attributes.action: Create a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children
attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. The risk of a child dying before five years of age is highest in Africa - about 8 times higher than in Europe. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Request intervention in Myanmar at the Security Council against genocide
attributes.background: soldiers in Myanmar have committed genocide according to the United Nations . Amnesty International has also found evidence including forensic medical evidence, corroborated witness testimony and satellite imagery of crimes against humanity.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/uk.mobile.reuters.com/article/amp/idUKKCN1GJ167
https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2018/06/atrocities-against-the-rohingya-how-we-built-the-case-to-implicate-myanmar-military-officials-in-crimes-against-humanity/

attributes.action: Hot weather payment to stay cool
attributes.background: Emergency payment for those in need to keep cool in such extreme heat
attributes.additional_details: Cold weather payments are made so people don't die of cold but a person can die of heat stroke just as much

attributes.action: Remove home address from UK Driving Licence.
attributes.background: Most people carry their driving licence and house keys together.  Having your home address on the licence is unnecessary as all information will be attached to the licence number.  It's time to end this potentially dangerous practice.

attributes.action: Lowering the voting age in referendums to 16
attributes.background: As some feel teenagers aren’t mature enough to vote in general elections, I feel as referendums such as Brexit ultimately affect the lives of young people, we should be allowed to have a say, as it defines our future.

attributes.action: Now facts are known, allow the public to vote between no deal or remaining in EU
attributes.background: The government can not agree on a brexit agreement with the EU, and now full facts on what a No deal brexit means, the public should be allowed to make an informed vote on remaining in the EU or having a no deal Brexit

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a system of Single-Transferable Vote
attributes.background: The UK voting system favours the mentality of 'tactical voting'. People vote for a party they do not very much agree with in order to keep a party they heavily disagree with from reaching a majority in Parliament. This leads to a stale two-party political system which leaves many disenfranchised.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1945, the only two Political Parties to reach a majority in Parliament are Labour and the Conservatives. 

In the 2015 election, UKIP received a total of 3,881,099 votes and achieved 1 MP; the Liberal Democrats achieved 2,415,916 votes but won 8 MP's. Nearly 4 million people were left without a significant voice in parliament. 

Australia currently operates under Single-Transferable vote and this has allowed many smaller parties to gain traction in their Government.

attributes.action: Require public transport providers to offer free transport to those in education
attributes.background: Most people who are still in education don't have a well paying job, or don't even have one. This means that travelling around is hard and can be very costly.
attributes.additional_details: We are taking part in a citizenship project and this is our topic/ issue. Not only will this make transport easier for people who are still trying to learn, but also means that the roads are clearer of young drivers. This therefore results in pollution levels from transport decreasing

attributes.action: Keep the Royal Air Force Aerobatic Team, the Red Arrows, in Lincolnshire
attributes.background: Lincolnshire has had strong links with the Royal Air Force since before its founding in 1918 and the Royal Air Force Aerobatic Team has been synonymous with Lincolnshire for more than 30 years. The Red Arrows team should be kept in the county if RAF Scampton is to close.
attributes.additional_details:
Tourism contributes £1.3billion to the Lincolnshire economy and the county's aviation heritage attracts people from all over the world. This came to the fore in 2018 with the RAF Lincolnshire promotion to mark the county’s long history to the RAF at 100. 

The Red Arrows team was formed in 1964 and has been based in Lincolnshire since 1983.

Please see visitlincoln.com/RAF to learn about Lincolnshire's links to aviation and the Royal Air Force, including how you can experience it today.

attributes.action: Outlaw all Premium and Higher rate telephone charges for mobiles and landlines.
attributes.background: Not all numbers are classified as Premium rates yet incur extortionate charges. Some Premium calls are regulated but some are not. The most vulnerable in society incur these charges. The proposal therefore is that all these telephone numbers, whether presently regulated or not are outlawed.

attributes.action: Reform law to safeguard public interests ensuring against abuse of police power
attributes.background: We need a full review of police powers to recommend ways to reform the police. The review must cover whether the police target innocent people and act to avoid accountability. It must look for illegality, irrationality, impropriety in procedures, and failure to abide by rules of natural justice.
attributes.additional_details: The police can target innocent people on the street or at home by saying that a crime was reported, intelligence was received, or they said or did something that looked suspicious. To protect the public from abuse of police powers, the review must consider whether the police must be made to provide within 14 days evidence to the individual/s of why that person was stopped, questioned or visited by the police and whether the police should have to apply to the court if they want to withhold any records/evidence.

attributes.action: Make the 30th March a public holiday to celebrate leaving the European union.
attributes.background: Leaving the European union is the largest democratic decision in our nation's history and should be celebrated as our independence day.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of 7.5% Cheap White Cider which is highly addictive and deadly!
attributes.background:
White Cider is likened to the 'heroin' of drinks. It is so cheap and widely available, it is popular with those in society that have very little income.
Cheap White Cider is easy to produce from imported apple juice, so does not impact the British Cider Industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Just a few examples........
https://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/terribly-sad-story-victim-cheap-15105742
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/16-year-old-girl-died-9864006
https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4248242/Teenager-16-died-bingeing-3-49-cider.html
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/nov/12/super-strength-cider-lager-killer-on-britain-streets-homelessness-rough-sleepers
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2011/apr/17/cider-industry-protected-expense-alcoholics

attributes.action: Stop the Tampon Tax
attributes.background: The tampon tax should be scrapped completely, or at the least reduced. This is something natural that women go through and shouldn’t be used to the government’s advantage.

attributes.action: Stop pets being sold online.
attributes.background: This is becoming a huge issue, people buy pets sometimes with bad intentions or purely for breeding therefore aren't buying your pet as a 'pet' to love and care for. This is massively on the increase and unwanted pets should be rehomed through trusted places such as dogs trust rather than eBay etc.
attributes.additional_details: These websites don't specialise in pets or regulations in that industry therefore you never really know what you're getting yourself into selling your pet on these sites. Professional agencies trusted to rehome your pets should be used. dogs are being sold on hundreds of sites for extremely cheap prices with no questions asked by the seller to the buyer regarding whether the requirements will be met for housing needs, food and dietary requirements. We must keep pets safe.

attributes.action: Allow Tier 2 (Intra-Company) individuals and their dependants to settle.
attributes.background: We have lived in the UK for 5 years and are not allowed to settle equally to colleagues on Tier 2 (general). Our parents are paying the same amounts of taxes, and not receiving any government services. It is not currently possible to apply for leave to remain with this visa made after April 2010.
attributes.additional_details: We have a private education and health insurance and aren't incurring expenses from the government. Our employment situation made UK our home, we grew up here and are about to enroll to universities; it is unreasonable to look elsewhere. Our parents are committed to careers in an international company; they will bring back their international earnings to UK to finance our education and settlement. As such, it is a win-win situation that merits consideration

attributes.action: Outlaw service charges on bar/restaurant bills
attributes.background: It should be illegal for bars and restaurants to add extra charges on to bills. The cost of a meal should be included in the price on the menu. Staff should not have to rely on tips to get a living wage, but should be paid properly.
attributes.additional_details: Customers should not feel obliged at the end of a meal to pay for what can feel like an extra meal price. In addition, the service provided by restaurants is not always justifiable to warrant paying a service charge.

attributes.action: Raise the practical driving test standards considerably.
attributes.background: By raising the Practical Driving Test Standards we can expect to see only the safest drivers pass and the road fatalities fall. If the standards are raised considerably everyone including young drivers will enjoy a lower insurance premium and safer roads.
attributes.additional_details:
The average cost for a young driver under the age of 25 to obtain an insurance in 2018 is a whopping £1400!

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/insurance/young-drivers/

Young drivers account for a quarter of road fatalities.

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/448039/young-car-drivers-2013-data.pdf

attributes.action: Ban strip clubs in the UK. Strip clubs are demeaning and sexually exploitive.
attributes.background: Ban strip clubs in the UK. They are demeaning, degrading and sexually exploitive to women. Whilst these establishments exist they pose a major obstacle to achieving equality between the sexes. Strip clubs convey the idea that women can be bought and hold no value. It is well past time for change.
attributes.additional_details: Strip clubs have no place in a civilised society where equality should be the norm, not the exception. It is time for women to be treated with respect and valued for more than their bodies. Allowing such an industry to exist encourages sexual violence and exploitation to women. Let's adopt the icelandic approach and ban these outdated institutions. If society does not value women enough to ban this archaic display of sexism then how can we expect women to value themselves. It is time for change.

attributes.action: The UK legal definition of rape should change to the US version.
attributes.background: The UK law means only penetration with a penis is considered rape. Instead, the US version should be used. This covers all forms of forced penetration. Penetration from an object can cause the same trauma as when penetrated by a penis, yet these victims attackers can get off more lightly.
attributes.additional_details:
UK DEFINITION

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1/crossheading/rape

Definition of rape - ( This version means only men can be charged and only when using their penis. )

"he intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with his penis,
(b)B does not consent to the penetration, and
(c)A does not reasonably believe that B consents."


US DEFINITION 

https://www.justice.gov/archives/opa/blog/updated-definition-rape

Definition of rape - 

“The penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim.”

attributes.action: Ban estate agents from managing family members’ properties.
attributes.background: After 6 years of nothing but stress due to a "estate agent" who was related/family member to my landlord renting a badly maintenanced property to me. I want a law in place to protect people who private rent from being put in my place.
attributes.additional_details:
I want restrictions that stop relatives who are estate agents/letting agents renting out properties to people for family members.
 
Estate agents make money renting a place out so not only do they make a financial gain themselves but for their family this would be disallowed in other professions as conflict of interest. 
This also gives the issue I had the place was in disrepair and the estate agent was the manager disregarded any laws in place to protect me as a Tenant to help his family.

attributes.action: legally require a receipt to be printed only if a customer actually wants one
attributes.background: Many large companies automatically print receipts for customers after small transactions (namely fast food shops and brands offering a self service experience). Customers often do not take these receipts. This is an incredible waste of paper that is not justifiable and can be easily avoided.

attributes.action: Ban strobe lighting to reduce the risks of epileptic seizures.
attributes.background: So many people are forced to turn away, close their eyes or even have others to protect them. It also prevents us to do something that normal people can do e.g. concerts. By banning strobes we would be reducing the risks of seizures and enable us to do something that anyone else could do.
attributes.additional_details: Being an epileptic myself, I know how it feels when we're unable to do something with friends or family, to describe it in anyway possible you feel alone. I would love to be able to do specific things such as concerts or horror mazes without having to wear sunglasses or close my eyes. If a seizure does occur in someone because of strobe lighting it can be fatal (SUDEP) to reduce this risk would be a major step forward. Many kinds of symptoms occur from epilepsy such as memory loss and depression.

attributes.action: Make all religious organisations give equal opportunities to men and women
attributes.background: Employment opportunities must be open to all without discrimination by law. The same must apply to all employment offered by religious organizations in Britain. The sex of the applicant must be made irrelevant.

attributes.action: Require all co.s  to have transparent complaints procedures & call waiting times
attributes.background: Many companies do not want to undergo the trouble and expense of engaging with their customers. Where customers have limited choice, there is limited recourse for customers, who have received a poor service or no service at all.
attributes.additional_details: A flight in July was cancelled by Easyjet. They have not paid compensation that is due. I have called four times and been kept waiting on each occasion more than half an hour, listening to a recording that blames 'unusual call volumes'. On the one occasion I spoke to a human, they explained that the systems were down and terminated the call.

attributes.action: Change House of Commons rules so MPs can call each other by their names
attributes.background: Enough is enough, we the people demand this reform in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Widen the A21
attributes.background:
East Sussex only has 11 miles of dual carriageway in the whole county this puts off investors and home buyers to the county as all the roads are slow and congested 
The A21 was planned to be duelled but was scrapped in the 2010 spending review 
The A21 is voted Britain’s most dangerous road
attributes.additional_details:
Widening of the A21 is required from kiplings cross Tunbridge Wells to Hastings 
Lives can be saved and journey times imporoved massively! 
This will give Hastings and East Sussex the infristruture is so desperately needs! 
As a county we have no motorways and pretty much no duel carriageways this causes stress and frustration it’s 2018 it’s about time the government do something to help East Sussex being as the neighboring county of Kent has 3 motorways and plenty of duel caraigeways

attributes.action: Label all ingredients (including soy oil) and create a soy tax
attributes.background: There are many people suffering from multiple food allergies, soy being one of the main culprits. It is hidden under more than 70 different names. I myself have purchased a product labelled 100% turkey and ended up in hospital because soy oil was not labelled. Allergies need to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: I have emailed the supplier of this product and all they have done is acknowledge they had soy oil in the product and offered a £4 refund. This is not enough. I was ill for a month. This is serious. Prepackaged food is over processed and has added soy in for no beneficial reason other than the fact it is a cheap alternative for the manufacturers. There is a sugar tax in action and I think there should also be a soy tax.
